content.text: The customer has a very specific use case with custom metrics.
The customer is trying to send two metrics:
One metric that indicates if the system is up
The end goal is to be able to have a metric that gives the operation/hour only when the system is up.

Example: The system is active for 30 minutes within an hour, and during that time, there were 100 operations. So operations per hour would be 100/hr, but the customer wants to be able to report "effective operations per hour" for that hour that was 200 (100 * 2 active time ratio).
They would like to use python Dogstatsd to send this.

function takes the per hour rate of each individual time bucket, so the logic of sending a metric if the system is up/down is not required to achieve the required goal. Getting the 200 will be automatic without sending the metric for system is up, and when system is down the per_hour rate will be 0.

from datadog import initialize, statsd
import time
options = {
'statsd_host':'127.0.0.1',
'statsd_port':8125
}
initialize(**options)
i = 0
while(i < 30):
i += 1
statsd.increment('test_hour', 3.333333333333333, tags=["env:dev"])time.sleep(60)
Sending 3.33 every minute for 30 minutes (total = 100), and trying to get the value of 200 in a notebook.
Why: Agent flush time of 15 seconds makes us believe that there were 3 points submitted, so to solve this issue, it is required to use rollup(sum, 60) to make sure the understood interval is 60.
We are now getting the value of 200 that we wanted.
However, I would expect the value of 200 to be present the whole time when the metric is being submitted (for 30 minutes). Do you have any thoughts on how can this be achieved?
Postmortem processes can be found here:
1. Remember to set a due date 5 working days forward on the card
2. Remember to add the appropriate Engineering Director and VP to the card
3. Add the internal and public postmortems as attachments
4. Drop them in the Engineering shared drive (under postmortems)
Please add the following information here:
—Link to Slack Channel and Link to Incident App

content.text: Customer has reported an issue with their
service showing an error message saying

2020-12-18T17:04:16Z I! [Util][DatadogClient][batch query][BatchQueryTimeseriesPointAndReFetchEmptySeries] 37 query response is empty. Fetch query response again. Refetch times: 1, Query parameters:...
For the list of queries that returned empty results, please see the below attached file:
service uses our batch query API endpoint to retrieve metrics from Datadog:
Customer believes the issue is from our end where the API endpoint is not returning any responses back to their
service. I’ve checked our Datadog Incidents page and Slack channels but don’t see anything that could possibly be related to it. The closest I found was this
Customer initially reported the issue suddenly started happening at
UTC time and has been happening ever since every few minutes.
Customer has shared some screenshots of the issue happening again at
The graphs seen from the above screenshots are here:

When I tried looking into those graphs, I couldn’t find any data (most likely because the metrics have aged out). Which led me to believe this is an Agent issue so I reviewed the Flares of their multiple Nodes and found the Agent seems to be working fine with the
The only errors from the Agent Flare that stood out to me is the Docker Integration check but the customer said the issue happens every few minutes and even
What did look suspicious is the number of errors shown for Forwarder Transaction and HTTP error:

=========
Forwarder
=========
  Transactions
  ============
    CheckRunsV1: 33,775
    Connections: 0
    Containers: 0
    Dropped: 350
    DroppedOnInput: 0
    Events: 0
    HostMetadata: 0
    IntakeV1: 3,659
    Metadata: 0
    Pods: 0
    Processes: 0
    RTContainers: 0
    RTProcesses: 0
    Requeued: 23,960
    Retried: 2,092
    RetryQueueSize: 0
    Series: 0
    ServiceChecks: 0
    SketchSeries: 0
    Success: 70,859
    TimeseriesV1: 33,775
  Transaction Errors
  ==================
    Total number: 110
    Errors By Type:
      ConnectionErrors: 86
      TLSErrors: 25
      WroteRequestErrors: 61
  HTTP Errors
  ==================
    Total number: 45
    HTTP Errors By Code:
 408: 45
Not too sure if that could be the reason why their metrics are sometimes not appearing in their account.
If this turns out to an Agent issue, I’ll move this card.
From my investigation, I thought this was an issue with the metrics not being tagged properly with

as that’s the tag (scope) used in all the queries that returned empty results. However, customer has advised their queries have always been working fine and no changes were made from the Agent side since UTC
. They’ve also shared screenshots of the queries where the metrics have values (mentioned above).
Metrics that are causing the issue:

kafka.consumer_lag 
kafka.broker_offset 
kafka.consumer_offset 
kubernetes_state.container.ready 
kubernetes_state.deployment.replicas_available 
kubernetes_state.deployment.replicas_desired 
kubernetes_state.node.cpu_capacity 
kubernetes_state.node.memory_capacity 
kubernetes_state.replicationcontroller.replicas_available 
kubernetes_state.replicationcontroller.replicas_desired 
kubernetes_state.statefulset.replicas_current 
kubernetes_state.statefulset.replicas_desired 
system.disk.in_use 
system.disk.read_time_pct 
system.disk.write_time_pct 
kubernetes.containers.restarts 
kubernetes.cpu.limits 
kubernetes.cpu.requests 
kubernetes.cpu.usage.total 
kubernetes.memory.limits 
kubernetes.memory.requests
were not shown on Datadog dashboard since UTC time
Checked the customer’s API rate limit for batch_query and can see they have already increased it to 10800 per hour.
Also checked McNulty logs to see if there are any 429 errors that suggest the customer is being API rate limited but found nothing.

I’m not sure if this is genuinely a metric API endpoint issue or the Agent not tagging the metrics correctly. I tried using sudogq commands to query the metrics but didn’t get any results (probably due to age out). However, the screenshots shared by the customer shows the metrics are tagged and can be queried successfully but the issue happens every few minutes. Agent logs doesn’t show anything definitive as to what could be causing this intermittent issue.
Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.
(Tried with sudogg and sudogq but no luck. Most likely due to metric aged out)

content.text: Kubernetes state metrics are still being submitted from a host that does not currently exist here.
These metrics come from the agent but they also have aws tags
There are no system metrics from the host, just KSM
The account has ~20 rather stable hosts, recycled rarely.

There are a lot of on-demand, short lived hosts as well, but they don't have the Datadog agent installed. Interestingly this AWS account has the EC2 integration disabled yet those instances that lack the agent are still discovered via the AWS integration. Is this behaviour expected?
Confirm they are churning hosts frequently -
Gather as many examples from the application including monitor evaluations and partlow links to graphs highlighting the issue -
For general aliasing issues (old data appearing on newer hosts), add the customer orgID under the section [dd.hosts.aliases.prune_dead.since_days_ago] with an interval of 8
For host-tag-specific aliasing issues, also add the customer to the [dd.host_tags.prune_from_inactive_hosts.since_hours_ago] section, with an interval of 24 (the maximum)
The PR only sets [dd.hosts.aliases.prune_dead.since_days_ago], let me know if in this case the [dd.host_tags.prune_from_inactive_hosts.since_hours_ago] is also needed.

content.text: Then on `Mon Dec 07 2020 07:18:48 GMT+0100` they created a new host with different configuration with clean Datadog-agent installation with different tags. However, this host is using tags from the old host.
Tag `cluster:ark` was used by old machine (almost 2 month ago) and `cluster: safari` belong to new machine. The metric also has two host tags:
The old host is still showing up as “up” in the infrastructure list even though there is neither an agent installed or the aws integration:
Is this the same issue discussed in
, and will adding the tag pruning job be the right solution here as well ?
Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.

content.text: Prefacing this to say that this is not an directly a metrics related issue, but had requested to move the support card here since the underlying issue seems to be with the hostname resolver.
Thejaswini from Fidelty’s team reached out because tags from AWS are not getting assigned to kubernetes events for pods deployed in a single region (us-east-2).
Whereas they are correctly tagged a different region (us-east-1) tagged with
It had been unclear why this would be the case though since the instance tagged on the event from us-east-2 has all aws tags
I had been sent in a few different directions, but ultimately it seems this is tied to how the tags are mapped to events on the backend.

Narrowed down the issue with Isaac from the events platform team and this appears to stem from the event silently failing to associate the hostname correctly since the alias is being formatted unexpectedly - right now it is interpreted as

dogdataprod=> select * from vs20752.host  where name  = 'i-08fdbddddeb8ad6df' and org_id = 184592;
id     | org_id |        name         |          created           |          modified          
----------------------------------------+---------------------------+----------------------------
 3310398455 | 184592 | i-08fdbddddeb8ad6df | 2020-11-12 14:31:05.748421 | 2020-11-12 14:31:05.748421
 
dogdataprod=> select * from vs20752.host_alias  where host_id = 3310398455 and org_id = 184592;
org_id |  host_id   |                                  name                                  |          created           |          modified          
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 184592 | 3310398455 | ip-10-234-189-37.us-east-2.compute.internal-amtech-preprod-2-us-east-2 | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557 | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557
184592 | 3310398455 | ip-10-234-189-37.ec2.internal                                          | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557 | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557
184592 | 3310398455 | i-08fdbddddeb8ad6df                                                    | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557 | 2020-11-12 14:39:27.959557
(3 rows)
In [1]: from dd.utils.context.host import get_host_tags, get_host_idIn [2]: org_id = 184592In [3]: host_name = 'ip-10-234-189-37.us-east-2.compute.internal'In [4]: h_id = get_host_id(org_id, host_name, use_layered_cache=False)
2020-12-17T20:40:58 INFO [dd.dd.utils.db] [1427] [db.py:270] - dogq is connecting to postgres @ None@:6432/host-pshard0-replica. Pgbouncer: True, timeout=0
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
HostNotFound                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-9c9cbebf13ee> in <module>()
----> 1 h_id = get_host_id(org_id, host_name, use_layered_cache=False)/opt/dogweb/lib/python2.7/site-packages/dd/utils/context/host.pyc in get_host_id(org_id, host_name, use_cached, use_layered_cache)
102             return host_id
103         else:
--> 104             raise HostNotFound((org_id, host_name))
105 
106 HostNotFound: (184592, 'ip-10-234-189-37.us-east-2.compute.internal')
Here are links to this specific example →kube events tagged with
Same instance with docker events correctly assigned with
as instance id and assigned with AWS tags -
from another host in the region that also is showing this behavior -
The discrepency seems to be how the host alias is namespaced between these events -
is a “found” host that exists on our backend and has events tagged with AWS tags but
is not an alias that exists on our backend (shown above) and no AWS tags are assigned to the events with this tag.
(just a further visual confirmation from the associated host in the infra list showing the mismatch)

content.text: Monitor is triggering on No Data, but when the graphs for the metric, it doesn't show the metric was not being reported during that period.
Checking the backend, we see that the metric is being registered as NaN during the period where the monitor alerted. Therefore, we can conclude that the Monitor triggered properly for
, scoping to the same time frame, the graph (SQR Phones Online) does not reflect the time period where no data was being triggered.
Searching for the metric for the query:
We can see that the results returned when changing the query to only cover
, it doesn’t return the NaN periods that are shown when querying for
. It seems like it skips the NaN period of
Is this an expected behaviour? Why does the metric value returned for the second query (scoped to a specific host) skip the NaN period? Does this have anything to do with interpolation?
Postmortem processes can be found here:
1. Remember to set a due date 5 working days forward on the card
2. Remember to add the appropriate Engineering Director and VP to the card
3. Add the internal and public postmortems as attachments
4. Drop them in the Engineering shared drive (under postmortems)

content.text: The customer was submitting a custom metric via the API that was a COUNT type called checkout.lambda_duration. They accidentally created a log-based metric that was called the same and so the metric-type switched to distribution in the Metric Summary page.
They are unable to get it to switch back, even after deleting the log-based metric and waiting a week for the metric to age out of the UI.
Confirmed with Mike that the metric still shows a summary so it was not removed when the Log-to-metric was removed, as was originally expected.
Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.
Postmortem processes can be found here:
1. Remember to set a due date 5 working days forward on the card

content.text: As per OH discussion with Brad 12/18
Customer reached out on chat was concerned there was an issue with them not getting metrics in on Monday.  After confirming in metric explorer that the metric had indeed come in partlow:
The customer then then advised it was not showing in their dashboard : first top cell:

I exported the dashboard query to a notebook and when scoped to a week, the metric indeed seemed to not be there on Monday, but when the cloned cell was scoped to the period Sun-Tues, the Monday data was there-
Please see Zendesk Support tab for further comments and attachments.
5/ query as the dashboard does. The -v parameter prints info on each step of the query including if there was a "Query Cache Hits" or not.
6/ query data directly from the stores without using any cache data.
Postmortem processes can be found here:
